S1: Would you like to go out to drink with me tonight?
S2: I really don’t know what to eat tonight so I might go out somewhere.

S1: I advise you to treat this matter very seriously as it is vital.
S2: You must take this most seriously, it will affect you.

S1: When I was going out to meet my friends there was a delay at the train station.
S2: The train operator announced to the passengers that the train would be delayed.

S1: Does music help you to relax, or does it distract you too much?
S2: Does this sponge look wet or dry to you?

S1: You must realise that you will definitely be punished if you play with the alarm.
S2: He will be harshly punished for setting the fire alarm off.

S1: I will make you laugh so much that your sides ache.
S2: When I tell you this you will split your sides laughing.

S1: You shouldn’t be covering what you really feel.
S2: There is no point in covering up what you said, we all know.

S1: Do you want to come with us to the pub behind the hill?
S2: We are going out for drinks tonight in Salford Quays if you would like to come.

S1: This key doesn’t seem to be working, could you give me another?
S2: I dislike the word quay, it confuses me, I always think of things for locks, there’s another one.

S1: The ghost appeared from nowhere and frightened the old man.
S2: The ghost of Queen Victoria appears to me every night, I don’t know why, I don’t even like the royals.

S1: You’re not a good friend if you’re not prepared to be present when I need you.
S2: A good friend always seems to be present when you need them.

S1: The children crossed the road very safely thanks to the help of the lollipop lady.
S2: It was feared that the child might not recover, because he was seriously ill.

S1: I have invited a variety of people to my party so it should be interesting.
S2: A number of invitations were given out to a variety of people inviting them down the pub.

S1: I offer my condolences to the parents of John Smith, who was unfortunately murdered.
S2: I express my sympathy to John Smith’s parents following his murder.

S1: Boats come in all shapes and sizes but they all do the same thing.
S2: Chairs can be comfy and not comfy, depending on the chair.

S1: If you continuously use these products, I guarantee you will look very young.
S2: I assure you that, by using these products consistently over a long period of time, you will appear really young.

S1: We ran farther than the other children that day.
S2: You ran farther than anyone today.

S1: I always like to have a slice of lemon in my drink especially if it’s Coke.
S2: I like to put a wedge of lemon in my drinks, especially cola.

S1: It seems like I’ve got eczema on my ear doctor, can you recommend something for me?
S2: I had to go to a chemist for a special rash cream for my ear.

S1: I am proud of our nation, well, most of it.
S2: I think of myself as being part of a nation.

S1: There was a heap of rubble left by the builders outside my house this morning.
S2: Sometimes in a large crowd accidents may happen, which can cause deadly injuries.

S1: Water freezes at a certain temperature, which is zero degrees Celsius.
S2: The temperature of boiling water is 100 C and the temperature of ice is 0 C.

S1: We got home safely in the end, although it was a long journey.
S2: Though it took many hours travel, we finally reached our house safely.

S1: A man called Dave gave his fianc´ee a large diamond ring for their engagement.
S2: The man presented a diamond to the woman and asked her to marry him.

S1: I used to run quite a lot, in fact once I ran for North Tyneside.
S2: I used to climb lots at school as we had a new climbing wall put in the gym.

S1: I love to laugh as it makes me happy as well as those around me.
S2: I thought we bargained that it would only cost me a pound.

S1: Because I am the eldest one I should be more responsible.
S2: Just because of my age, people shouldn’t think I’m a responsible adult, but they do?

S1: I need to dash into the kitchen because I think my chip pan is on fire.
S2: In the event of a chip pan fire follow the instructions on the safety note.

S1: Peter was a very large youth, whose size intimidated most people, much to his delight.
S2: Now I wouldn’t say he was fat, but I’d certainly say he was one of the larger boys.

S1: I’m going to buy a grey jumper today, in half an hour.
S2: That’s a nice grey top, where did you get it from?

S1: We got soaked in the rain today, but now we are nice and dry.
S2: I was absolutely soaking wet last night, I drove my bike through the worst weather.

S1: Global warming is what everyone is worrying about today.
S2: The problem of global warming is a concern to every country in the world at the moment.

S1: He was harshly punished for setting the fire alarms off.
S2: He delayed his response, in order to create a tense atmosphere.

S1: That’s not a very good car, on the other hand mine is great.
S2: This is a terrible noise level for a new car.

S1: There was a terrible accident, a pileup, on the M16 today.
S2: It was a terrible accident, no one believed it was possible.

S1: After hours of getting lost we eventually arrived at the hotel.
S2: After walking against the strong wind for hours he finally returned home safely.

S1: The first thing I do in a morning is make myself a cup of coffee.
S2: The first thing I do in the morning is have a cup of coffee.

S1: Someone spilt a drink accidentally on my shirt, so I changed it.
S2: It appears to have shrunk, it wasn’t that size before I washed it.

S1: I’m worried most seriously about the presentation, not the essay.
S2: It is mostly very difficult to gain full marks in today’s exam.

S1: It is mostly very difficult to gain full marks in today’s exam.
S2: The exam was really difficult, I’ve got no idea if I’m going to pass.

S1: Meet me on the hill behind the church in half an hour.
S2: Join me on the hill at the back of the church in thirty minutes time.

S1: If you don’t console with a friend, there is a chance you may hurt their feelings.
S2: One of the qualities of a good friend is the ability to console.

S1: We tried to bargain with him but it made no difference, he still didn’t change his mind.
S2: I tried bargaining with him, but he just wouldn’t listen.

S1: It gives me great pleasure to announce the winner of this year’s beauty pageant.
S2: It’s a real pleasure to tell you who has won our annual beauty parade.

S1: They said they were hoping to go to America on holiday.
S2: I like to cover myself up in lots of layers, I don’t like the cold.

S1: Will I have to drive far to get to the nearest petrol station?
S2: Is it much farther for me to drive to the next gas station?

S1: I think I know her from somewhere because she has a familiar face.
S2: You have a very familiar face, where do I know you from?

S1: I am sorry but I can’t go out as I have a heap of work to do.
S2: I’ve a heap of things to finish so I can’t go out I’m afraid.

S1: The responsible man felt very guilty when he crashed into the back of someone’s car.
S2: A slow driver can be annoying even though they are driving safely.

S1: Get that wet dog off my brand new white sofa.
S2: Make that wet hound get off my white couch – I only just bought it.

S1: He fought in the war in Iraq before being killed in a car crash.
S2: The prejudice I suffered whilst on holiday in Iraq was quite alarming.

S1: The cat was hungry so he went into the back garden to find lunch.
S2: The hen walked about in the yard eating tasty grain.

S1: My bedroom wall is lemon coloured but my mother says it is yellow.
S2: Roses can be different colours, it has to be said red is the best though.

S1: Would you like to drink this wine with your meal?
S2: Will you drink a glass of wine while you eat?

S1: Roses can be different colours, it has to be said red is the best though.
S2: Roses come in many varieties and colours, but yellow is my favourite.

S1: Flies can also carry a lot of disease and cause maggots.
S2: I dry my hair after I wash it or I will get ill.

S1: Could you climb up the tree and save my cat from jumping please?
S2: Can you get up that tree and rescue my cat otherwise it might jump?

S1: The pleasure that I get from studying, is that I learn new things.
S2: I have a doubt about this exam, we never got to study for it.

S1: The perpetrators of war crimes are rotten to the core.
S2: There are many global issues that everybody should be aware of, such as the threat of terrorism.

S1: The damp was mostly in the very corner of the room.
S2: The young lady was somewhat partially burnt from the sun.

S1: We often ran to school because we were always late.
S2: I knew I was late for my class so I ran all the way to school.

S1: I hope you’re taking this seriously, if not you can get out of here.
S2: The difficult course meant that only the strong would survive.

S1: I bought a new guitar today, do you like it?
S2: The weapon choice reflects the personality of the carrier.

S1: I am so hungry I could eat a whole horse plus dessert.
S2: I could have eaten another meal, I’m still starving.
